column2: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
column4: where land over land: compute the total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

column4: summed over all soil layers, where land over land: compute by dividing the total mass of frozen water contained in the soil layer of the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

summed over all soil layers, where land over land: compute by dividing the total mass of water (both liquid and ice) contained in the soil layer of the grid cell by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.

column2: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
column4: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass resulting from their conversion to water vapor.  Compute as the total sublimation on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions; report as 0.0 where the land fraction is 0.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column2: Downward Heat Flux into Snow Where Land over Land
column4: Compute the net downward heat flux from the atmosphere into the snow that lies on land divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as 0.0 for snow-free land regions or where the land fraction is 0.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land
